availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis B. Kearney (Cincinnati, Ohio, raftsman and shoemaker.)

body.p: Cincinnati, Ohio, raftsman and shoemaker. Connecticut native. Married to Hellen Kearney. Father of William F. Kearney, John T. Kearny, and Francis Kearny. Raftsman in Wayne County, Virginia, in 1850. Shoemaker in Cincinnati, Ohio, in 1860. Lumber merchant in Cincinnati in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virigina, Wayne, District 66, p. 241A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 15, p. 389.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati, Ward 17, p. 258A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Hamilton County, KY, June 1863, p. 173.
